content.rendered:
Photo by Gratisography

This Week in Genesis some big news about Wix & GenesisWP.guide, Genesis Framework Month kicks off at Know The Code, and more showcase awesomeness.

Let’s get to it.

GenesisWP.guide to be acquired by Wix, switching to 100% Wix coverage

Before the regular round-up this week one piece of news I feel I should share.

After long and, at times, drawn out discussions I have accepted an all cash offer from Wix (the popular website builder) to acquire GenesisWP.guide.

When I started GenesisWP.guide almost a year ago the furthest thing from my mind was some kind of acquisition (and the site generates no income) but, having spoken to the people at Wix and seen their amazing website platform, I’ve come to realise that Wix is the future and that it’s in everyone’s interest to accept this, move on and not waste any more time with things like clean code or accessibility.

Sure we’ve had some fun with Genesis – and what a great framework it is – but, clearly, Wix is the future.

On that note, we’ll be switching to full Wix coverage next week, however, before then, I have one final round-up of Genesis news for you.

Themes

Riot! Customs releases a free Genesis child theme, Simply Noted.

Introducing Simply Noted – A Free Genesis Child Theme https://t.co/1Y85iag8Bl #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/ovtzOeyyuN

— Riot! Customs (@RiotCustoms) March 27, 2016

Frank shares an update on his latest theme design.

Still working on this:https://t.co/znZb8hzgF5 #genesiswp

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) March 31, 2016

Showcase

Two strong sites (as ever) from Emily White and Greg Young. First up, abbeyskitchen.com…

Client's personality shines through on this new custom #genesiswp site design that @hbgreg and I recently launched: https://t.co/hrC6hNruir

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) March 25, 2016

…next up, naturesnutureblog.com

Pleased to launch this custom #genesiswp design for https://t.co/vFxuCBb08f. @hbgreg and I couldn't ask for a nicer client! @NaturesNurture

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) March 25, 2016

Scott Wyden Kivowitz with a nice Squarespace to WordPress conversion for pencilandlens.com

Happy to have migrated https://t.co/bV6TFmiNIy from Squarespace to WordPress, running on @Imagely’s Lightly theme #GenesisWP #WordPress

— Scott Wyden Kivowitz (@scottwyden) March 28, 2016

RoadWarrior Creative with a great new site for leanimpact.org

New #wordpress #website launched for @leanimpact https://t.co/fT2Np51Hbq #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Upj88xs1nT

— RoadWarrior Creative (@roadwarriorwp) March 25, 2016

Genesis community star Susan Ramsey revamps her own site, onehappystudio.com

Working on a new #GenesisWP theme to be published this week; in the meantime, I just did a revamp of my own site: https://t.co/B2MXeSOcIh

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) March 28, 2016

Nicola Tweed for fathimasstudio.com

New website launched today! Fathima's Studio… https://t.co/TGdaZg8OD0 #genesiswp #wordpress #webdesign #webdevelopment #blog #website

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) March 30, 2016

Super minimal vibes from Cody Lamar Holtz on ialivedigital.com

Updated website. Made a few small changes and gave the homepage an overhaul. https://t.co/5utOLMop0G #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/b8I0jyJ5BD

— Cody Lamar Holtz (@mrcodylamar) March 31, 2016

Podcasts

After a break last week, Carrie Dils rocks the mic again over on the OfficeHours.fm podcast, this week chatting to Philip Morgan on how to position your business.

Excited to have @Philip_Morgan
on the show this week to talk about positioning your business! https://t.co/SoUnVhVFlS #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) March 28, 2016

Best of the rest

Starting today, it’s Genesis Framework Month over on Know the Code and they’re giving away a copy of Carrie Dils’ Utility Pro theme to celebrate.

Hey #GenesisWP – We’re giving away @cdils Utility Pro Professional license as we gear up for Genesis April https://t.co/pdTszXoMyR.

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) March 28, 2016

The Genesis community’s very own Bill Erickson and Jared Atchison launch EA Share Count a new sharing plugin aimed at developers.

Announcing EA Share Count. Sharing plugin developed by @billerickson and myself – https://t.co/0uSbGTE0KT

— Jared Atchison (@jaredatch) March 29, 2016

Learn more about the Genesis community’s Scott Ellis in this interview with grafixCat media.

Before he was slinging code, @vsellis was slinging donuts. Learn more #Entrepreneur Stories https://t.co/eiREOiCRws #genesiswp

— grafixcatmedia (@grafixcatmedia) March 31, 2016

And, of course, Sridhar’s prolific as ever this week!

  • CPT archive in Genesis with custom fields in a lightbox gallery using Magnific Popup
  • Adding Altitude Pro’s Flexible Widgets in Centric Pro
  • How to enable Content Sidebar layout in Remobile Pro
  • How to enclose Headline and Intro Text in a wrap on archive pages in Genesis
  • How to remove post info in Genesis for all post types other than ‘post’
  • Fixed Primary Navigation on Scroll in Foodie Pro using Sticky-Kit
  • How to automatically divide Posts into top, middle and bottom sections in Genesis

How to automatically divide Posts into top, middle and bottom sections in Genesis: https://t.co/Mq831Mmgvi pic.twitter.com/H9dWYlnIXj

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) April 1, 2016

And finally…

Genesis contributor and accessibility superstar Rian Rietveld picks up a very deserved Knowability Heroes of a11y award. Congrats Rian!

This is the video where @RianRietveld won her @knowbility Heroes of a11y award. Start watching from 6:50.https://t.co/LlLMDBQR4X #genesiswp

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) March 29, 2016

That’s all for this week.

Make sure to swing by next week though, when guest editor Tara Claeys will be you through all the latest and great Wix news (or, in the extremely unlikely event the Wix deal does not go through, the latest Genesis news).

Either way it’s sure to be a good one, so see you then!

PS If you enjoy these updates I’d love it if you subscribe. Just enter your email address below and you’ll get one (very occasionally, two) emails a week all about Genesis Wix.

excerpt.rendered: Some big news about Wix and GenesisWP.guide, Genesis Framework Month kicks off at Know The Code, and more showcase awesomeness.
